Dear Ms. Doan-Motsinger:
Attached is the Original Licensing Study Report for the above referenced facility. The
study has determined substantial compliance with applicable licensing statutes and
administrative rules. Therefore, an original license is issued.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Heather Reilly, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
22 Center Street
Ypsilanti, MI 48198
(734) 660-8309

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS & CONCLUSIONS
A. Physical Description of Facility
Our House is an agency located in Ypsilanti, Michigan. They currently run outreach
programs for youth in the area, providing access to community resources and
services. This program has been active since 2012. At this time, the agency wishes
to expand their services and begin an Independent Living program to provide
housing and services to youth in the foster care system. This program is in the
process of obtaining an ILP contract with MDHHS. This contract is expected to be
effective 9/1/21.
The agency has a three-year rental agreement for two houses in Ypsilanti, which will
be utilized as staff supported housing for ILP youth.
One house, located at 602 Emmet St., is a three story, twelve-bedroom, three-
bathroom home. With a kitchen, living room, dining area, office space, and ample
storage. The home has an exterior fire escape from the third floor to comply with fire
safety regulations. The home also has smoke alarms in every bedroom and a
carbon monoxide detector. The agency has been gifted furniture to fully furnish the
house. The home was observed on 7/13/21. This is an older style home but appears
to be safe and in good condition.
The second house, located at 214 W. Forest, is a two story, five-bedroom, two-
bathroom home. With a kitchen, living room, dining area, and office space. There is
an unfinished basement which will be utilized for storage. The home also has smoke
alarms on each level and a carbon monoxide detector. The home was observed on
7/13/21 and found to be safe and in good condition
The agency’s office is located at 111 S. Wallace Blvd. in the rented office space of a
former elementary school. The building has large rooms available to conduct
meetings and trainings. The Our House program currently occupies office space with
secured locking storage to ensure confidentiality of case files. The office space was
viewed and found to comply with licensing rules for CPAs.
3

B. Program Description
The Our House “Mosaic” program is designed for Independent Living eligible DHHS
youth ages 16-25 that are transitioning from foster care to independence. The
program will provide staff supported housing, services, and community support for
youth in foster care or Youth Adult Voluntary Foster Care (YAVCF) through DHHS.
Youth must meet eligibility criteria for the ILP program as outlined in the agency’s
Program Statement and agree to follow agency policies and procedures. Our House
plans to focus on Positive Youth Development as a holistic approach to prepare
youth for adulthood. This approach is intended to increase youth potential, decrease
risky behaviors, and improve social and emotional outcomes by uplifting youth
strengths, rather than focusing on deficits.
Our House will provide safe housing, including furniture, linens, and food. Staff will
provide case management services, assist youth with financial literacy, mentoring,
access to supportive services, and transition planning. The agency has received a
copy of DCWL CPA licensing rules and a copy of DHHS contract requirements. The
Chief Administrator understands the requirements of licensing rules and DHHS
policy/contract.
The agency Program Statement, policies/procedures, forms, job descriptions, and
budget were reviewed and found to be in compliance with licensing rules. The
agency will operate with a Chief Administrator/Supervisor and two Case
Managers/House Staff initially. Additional support staff will be hired as needed,
based on the number of youth served. The CA and one Case Manager are in the
process of completing CWTI training. Training will be completed prior to accepting
any cases from DHHS. The agency is aware of the caseload size restrictions in
place while completing CWTI training.
Financially, the program is currently funded through donations, grants, and
community partnerships. With the addition of the ILP program, the agency will also
receive the DHHS Administrative Rate. While Our House does not rely on the DHHS
administrative rate, this income has been added to the projected budget. The
projected budget for 2021/2022 was reviewed; no concerns were noted.
C. Rule/Statutory Violations
The agency is in compliance with all licensing rules and statues.
4

IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend issuance of an original provisional license.
July 16, 2021
Heather Reilly Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
July 16, 2021
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
